page.title: 14Capton Fruit Farm
page.content: Capton fruit farm is 25 acres altogether.It has been a Fruit farm for 15 years.Capton is one of the oldest hamlets and was mentioned in the original Domesday Book.Capton fruit farm sells about a ton of strawberries a day.There is a little museum of things found in the fruit farm.They have found spearheads,a charm ring,a brooch and some flints. Mr Lloyd and Mrs Lloyd own the farm. On a south facing slope they have planted grapevines and now sell their own wine.They grow all types of soft fruit and vegetables for people to pick for themselves."Pick your own" farms have become very popular in South Devon.In July 1985 you could pick a pound of strawberries for 56 pence.
